title: Special Use Cases
section: Connecting to the Library VPN (for library staff)
text:
Connecting to the Library VPN (for library staff)

Login to https://vpn.library.ucsb.edu, download client.ovpn.
Upload client.ovpn to your workspace using the File Browser.
Install VPN client: bash     sudo apt install -y apt-transport-https curl     sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings     sudo sh -c 'curl -sSfL https://packages.openvpn.net/packages-repo.gpg >/etc/apt/keyrings/openvpn.asc'     sudo sh -c 'echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/openvpn.asc] https://packages.openvpn.net/openvpn3/debian noble main" >>/etc/apt/sources.list.d/openvpn3.list'     sudo apt update     sudo apt install -y openvpn3
Import profile: openvpn3 config-import --config $client.ovpn
Start session: openvpn3 session-start --config client.ovpn (prompts for library credentials).
Disconnect: openvpn3 session-manage --disconnect --config client.ovpn

Note: DNS name resolution may be broken after disconnecting; sudo systemctl restart systemd-resolved might fix it.

Workspace Lifecycle

Automatic Shutdown: Workspaces shut down after four hours of inactivity.
Resuming: Click the “Start” button in the upper-right corner of the workspace page.
Deletion: Select “Delete” from the drop-down menu in the upper-right corner. Warning: Deleting the workspace deletes all files.

text:
Coder Workspaces are on-demand virtual machines provided by UCSB Dreamlab with commonly used data science tools. They are accessible to anyone with an active UCSB Net ID.

title: Workspaces Overview
text:
Policies

Backup your data: Data is not backed up; users are responsible for their own backups.
Deletion: All workspaces are automatically deleted at the end of each quarter.
Limits: Users may create and use only one workspace at a time. Multiple active workspaces may be deleted without notice.
Maintenance: Workspaces may be inaccessible during scheduled maintenance windows (announced via email).
Inactivity: Workspaces stop automatically after four hours of inactivity to conserve resources. They can be resumed by clicking the “start” button.
Software Installation: Users may install additional software.
Access by Staff: Workspaces may be accessed by staff in the Library or LSIT. Confidential or sensitive information should not be stored.

title: Workspaces Overview
text:
Workspace Lifecycle

Workspaces shut down (stop) after four hours of inactivity.
You can manually stop a workspace by clicking the “stop” button.
To start a stopped workspace, click the workspace’s “Start” button. It may take a few minutes to resume.
Deleting a workspace deletes all files on the workspace!
All workspaces will be deleted at the end of each academic quarter.
